definition: to execute by firing squad/to shoot dead/fig. to discard/to get rid of
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
surname Qiang
variant of 槍|枪[qiang1]/rifle/spear
to die/to shoot dead/to reject/to fall forward/(suffix) to death
to collapse/variant of 斃|毙[bi4]/variant of 獙[bi4]

sentences.english: I killed someone, so I had to go. Otherwise I would be captured and sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 杀了人，我害怕被警察抓住判刑枪毙。

sentences.english: Piani would tell them they had shot me.
sentences.chinese: 皮安尼会告诉他们我被枪毙了。

sentences.english: If they were to catch me, they would shoot me.
sentences.chinese: 假使有人捉住我，他们就会枪毙我。

sentences.english: The prisoners were led out in batches and shot.
sentences.chinese: 这些囚犯被分批带出去枪毙了。

sentences.english: Despite his request that he would rather by shot, the court did not favor him.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他宁愿被枪毙，但法庭并没有满足他的要求。

sentences.english: They did not shoot me; they pushed back their chairs and left.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有枪毙我，而是向后推开椅子转身离开了。

sentences.english: They did not shoot me;they pushed back their chairs and left.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有枪毙我，而是向后推开椅子转身离开了。

sentences.english: Austin expected to be shot on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 奥斯汀预料自己会被当场枪毙。

sentences.english: The moral equivalent is putting a jaywalker before a firing squad.
sentences.chinese: 在道义上说，这就相当于把一个乱穿马路的人枪毙。

sentences.english: Because it’s easier and cheaper to starve people to death than to shoot them.
sentences.chinese: 因为把人民饿死，要比挨个枪毙更经济，也更容易。

sentences.english: And they will look at your hands. You smell of powder. Shot.
sentences.chinese: 他们会叫你伸出手来看，发现手上有火药味，就枪毙。

sentences.english: In China they may shoot the owner and confiscate the company.
sentences.chinese: 而在中国你会被枪毙，公司会被充公。

sentences.english: They immediately dragged many Formosan youths into the street and shot them.
sentences.chinese: 他们马上就把许多台湾青年拖到大街上枪毙。

sentences.english: Your friends have just shot you.
sentences.chinese: 你的朋友刚才把你枪毙了。

sentences.english: Very soon, he was brought to the execution ground and shot.
sentences.chinese: 很快的，他就被带上刑场枪毙。

sentences.english: Our friends in the Royal Irish Constabulary would like to shut me up.
sentences.chinese: 我们皇家爱尔兰警察部队的朋友们很希望枪毙我。

definition: to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
to execute (a condemned criminal)
to die/to shoot dead/to reject/to fall forward/(suffix) to death
to collapse/variant of 斃|毙[bi4]/variant of 獙[bi4]
to parade (a prisoner) through the streets
to execute on the spot (idiom); summary execution/to carry out the law on the spot
an execution/to put sb to death
to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
to execute by hanging
to kill/to beat to death
guilty of terrible crimes (idiom)/reprehensible
death penalty
to shoot dead
court-martial/military tribunal
to sentence (to prison etc)
the crime of treason
to behead sb and display the head in public
